ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: overall familiarity with yearlong thesis writing process and guidelines, how to use Yale library resources

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: this course should meet every other week and peer-to-peer workshopping should be its priority. I appreciated the structure and support in beginning and fleshing out our theses but some classes we only spent giving one another updates on rather than reading and engaging our projects. I think we would be more accountable to our projects and ourselves if we prioritized peer workshopping in our class (we only had one class session where we did this).

Strengths: it was helpful to have a community to share challenges and updates regarding the thesis research and writing process, Prof Tran and Taty were always very kind and understanding instructors; Weaknesses: the readings on how to write a thesis would have been much more relevant second semester, when most of the writing process actually happens. More time could have been spent on the initial research question formulation process. A tutorial on how to use Zotero/citation management applications could have also been helpful. Furthermore, I would have preferred meeting every two weeks as a group and instead having more 1:1 meetings with Professor Tran and Taty.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: it's required if you're writing a yearlong thesis; a lot of the actual thesis work happens outside of this class and with your advisor so if you tend to procrastinate a lot I would make sure you have an advisor who will keep you on top of your work/deadlines
